is a city and regency south east of
Tasikmalaya is also known as simply Tasik, which means 'sea'.
, it can be reach within 2.5 hours travel from
using national road via Limbangan - Malangbong - Ciawi or 3.5 hours travel using alternative road via
Tasikmalaya can be reach by Bus from any major cities in Java such as from Jakarta (24 hours bus from Jakarta are available), from Bandung (daylight from 5 AM to 7 PM),
If you want to head to Tasikmalaya by Train, it can be reach by Executive and Business class train from Bandung, and also economy class train from Kiaracondong Bandung and from Jakarta.
Travel around the city by using available angkot (city transport) to take you to several place in Tasikmalaya, or perhaps ucing a Becak and Delman

value: - A traditional village with traditional culture located at the bank of Ciwulan river at Salawu district, west of Tasikmalaya.
- Natural beach located at southernmost part of Tasikmalaya, about 90 Km from Tasikmalaya city.
- Religious tourism object, located at Bantarkalong district, the place where Syeikh Abdul Muhyi tomb (Well known Islamic missionaries) located.
- Natural beach located on Southern East part of the regencies.
- Small natural lake located near the heart of Tasikmalaya city.
- Find the traditional wood craft from Tasikmalaya at Rajapolah, a well known
district located at northern part of Tasikmalaya.
- Traditional embroidery made in Tasikmalaya, can be found at Kawalu district.

There are many hotels in Tasikmalaya to choose from.  There is a cheap hotel, Merdeka, right down the road by the train station.  Hotel Aden is also quite cheap at around 50,000 per night.
